meanings.definition: To erase or remove a drawing or image.
meanings.sent1: She undraws the mistake on her sketch.
meanings.sent2: He undraws the doodle on the whiteboard.
meanings.sent3: The artist undraws the cat but leaves the dog in the picture.
meanings.sent4: The eraser undraws the pencil marks effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: With a swift motion, she undraws the incorrect lines.

meanings.definition: To reverse the action of drawing something.
meanings.sent1: Pressing 'undo' undraws the last stroke on the digital canvas.
meanings.sent2: The magician undraws the rabbit back into the hat.
meanings.sent3: The rewind button undraws the car chase scene in the movie.
meanings.sent4: Time travel undraws the events of the past.
meanings.sent5: The spellcaster's incantation undraws the magical symbol in the air.

meanings.definition: To retract or cancel a previous decision or statement.
meanings.sent1: He undraws his promise to attend the event.
meanings.sent2: The company undraws their offer of partnership.
meanings.sent3: The politician undraws his support for the new law.
meanings.sent4: The student undraws his answer on the test paper.
meanings.sent5: The apology undraws the tension in the room.
